verbs.description: liven (third-person singular simple present livens, present participle livening, simple past and past participle livened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To cause to be more lively, or to become more lively.

description: From Middle English liven, equivalent to live +â€Ž -en.

examples: What shoulden shepheards other things tend,Then, sith their God his good does them send,Reapen the fruite thereof, that is pleasure,The while they here liven, at ease and leasure?
